means: 戏剧表演和创作的研究或实践，戏剧性的行为

sentence.Network_en: Angela says she longs to join an amateur dramatics class.
sentence.Network_cn: 安杰拉说她渴望参加业余戏剧班。

sentence.Network_en: His dramatics made all of us laugh.
sentence.Network_cn: 他那戏剧性的动作使我们大家都笑了.

sentence.Network_en: He had a finger in every pie at school, from dramatics to football.
sentence.Network_cn: 在学校里, 从演戏到踢足球,什么活动他都参加.

entry.def: You use dramatics to refer to activities connected with the theatre and drama, such as acting in plays or producing them.

example.ex: Angela says she longs to join an amateur dramatics class.
example.tran: 安杰拉说她渴望参加业余戏剧班。

entry.tran: 夸张的行为;做作的举止
entry.def: You talk about dramatics to express your disapproval of behaviour which seems to show too much emotion, and which you think is done deliberately in order to impress people.

example.tran: 南希又一次令人厌烦的装腔作势的举动

means.word_mean: 1. participation in theatrical productions as an extracurricular activity
2. the art of writing and producing plays
